meanings.definition: The ability of an organism to produce its own food using energy from sunlight or inorganic substances.
meanings.sent1: Autotrophy is essential for plants to make their own food.
meanings.sent2: Some bacteria rely on autotrophy to survive in extreme environments.
meanings.sent3: The sun thought autotrophy was a cool superpower to have.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of life, autotrophy is the master chef creating meals from sunlight.
meanings.sent5: Autotrophy is like a magical cooking skill that turns sunlight into energy-rich dishes.

meanings.definition: The process by which an organism obtains energy from sunlight or inorganic substances to produce its own food.
meanings.sent1: Autotrophy is a fascinating process that sustains many living beings.
meanings.sent2: Plants use autotrophy to convert sunlight into nutrients through photosynthesis.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria had a party celebrating their autotrophy skills.
meanings.sent4: In the dance of life, autotrophy is the graceful movement of energy from the sun to the organism.
meanings.sent5: Autotrophy is like a solar-powered factory that manufactures food for the organism.
